item.title: 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' DLC: 'Persona 5' Character Coming In First Challenge Pack - Forbes
item.description:
'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' DLC: 'Persona 5' Character Coming In First Challenge Pack  Forbes

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate just released on December 7 for the Nintendo Switch, but we’ve already learned about the first piece of DLC. As a part of the Challenger 1 Pack, Joker from the Persona 5 franchise will be added to the game. Joker in SSBU This announcement was made and revealed at the 2018 Video Game Awards in Los Angeles on Thursday night. Here is a look at the trailer: clearly, we wish there was a snippet of gameplay with Joker and/or on his stage, but based on the early reviews of SSBU, we’d be inclined to expect a solid and imaginative rendering. This is a significant add for S...

item.title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate review | A riotous fighter and gloriously bonkers video game celebration - The Telegraph
item.description:
Super Smash Bros. Ultimate review | A riotous fighter and gloriously bonkers video game celebration  The Telegraph

Nearly twenty years after the first Super Smash Bros, the core appeal of Nintendo’s raucous fighter remains the same: being able to give Pikachu a good shoeing. Or using Donkey Kong to ground Fox McCloud by headbutting him into the dirt. Or allowing Princess Peach her ultimate revenge, belting Bowser into the stratosphere using a baseball bat. But in contrast to the ability for Nintendo characters to impart cartoonish violence on one another, Super Smash Bros. is also a celebration. A party to which anyone or anything that has graced a Nintendo console is invited, and the entertainment is a...

item.title: 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' Release Date And 10 Things You Should Know Before You Buy The Game - Forbes
item.description:
'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' Release Date And 10 Things You Should Know Before You Buy The Game  Forbes

As Nintendo Switch exclusives go, there aren’t many that are more valuable than the upcoming Super Smash Bros. Ultimate. SSBU for Nintendo Switch This iconic series has rarely produced a dud and with more characters than ever, expectations are high for yet another noteworthy achievement. SSBU releases on December 7 and here are the 10 things you should know about the final major video game release of 2018. Special Edition Info The Standard Edition will cost $59.99 and just comes with the game. MyBestBuy and Amazon Prime members are getting $10 reward certificate for buying the game. There’s...

item.title: When Can You Play 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate'? - International Business Times
item.description:
When Can You Play 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate'?  International Business Times

After years of waiting, the latest and biggest game in the venerable “Super Smash Bros.” franchise is almost here. The Nintendo Switch-exclusive “Super Smash Bros. Ultimate” launches on Friday, but people in different time zones might be able to play it before then, as is usually the case with downloadable games. Those who pre-ordered the digital version of the game on the Switch eShop can most likely play it starting on midnight ET on Friday, or 9 p.m. PT on Thursday, according to Shack News. If it does not work at 9 p.m. for players on the west coast, it should be available at midnight in...

item.title: How To Download A User-Created 'Super Smash Bros' Ultimate' Instruction Manual - Forbes
item.description:
How To Download A User-Created 'Super Smash Bros' Ultimate' Instruction Manual  Forbes

Back in the day, even the most self-explanatory video games shipped with a manual. That time has passed and the most you’ll get these days is an in-game menu with all of the commands. SSBU user-created manual The upcoming Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is no different, but that just wasn’t acceptable for OharaLibrarianArtur (h/t Kotaku). These Redditors created their own high-quality instruction manual and they uploaded it for anyone to print if needed. When I say high quality, I’m not just blowing smoke. Take a look at these images of the manual: Sample page from user-created SSBU manual Sampl...

item.title: Nintendo's Switch fortunes persist - TechCrunch
item.description:
Nintendo's Switch fortunes persist  TechCrunch

The Nintendo Switch continues to prove itself as quite the formidable little console. Today, Nintendo shared a press release of victory lap brags from its Thanksgiving weekend sales. The company detailed that $250 million in Nintendo products were purchased over the four-day period with the company's Nintendo Switch console leading the way. The company also revealed that after 20 months, they've sold 8.2 million Switch units in the US, with this past week representing the best week of sales for the device yet. In January, the company made a big PR push for its Switch numbers, announcing tha...

item.title: How Smash Bros. Ultimate Characters Are Chosen, And Why Other Games Should Emulate This Process - Forbes
item.description:
How Smash Bros. Ultimate Characters Are Chosen, And Why Other Games Should Emulate This Process  Forbes

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is arguably the biggest video game release of December. Fans of the series are waiting with bated breath for every detail on the game ahead of its December 7 release exclusively on the Nintendo Switch. Super Smash Bros. Ultimate On Wednesday, Game Informer revealed game director Masahiro Sakurai and his team’s thought process when selecting the characters that would make up the roster for the SSBU game. Sakurai said it was important to include all characters from previous versions of the game. There are obviously a ton of characters within his reach that he could ...

item.title: 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' And The 5 Biggest Video Game Releases In December 2018 - Forbes
item.description:
'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' And The 5 Biggest Video Game Releases In December 2018  Forbes

December is never really a huge month for video game releases and 2018 is no exception. WASHINGTON, DC – OCTOBER 8: Super Smash Bros Ultimate by Nintendo is part of The Washington Post via Getty Images annual gift guide October 08, 2018 in Washington, DC. (Photo by Katherine Frey/The Washington Post via Getty Images) That said, there are a handful of games that might be worth a look. In fact, there are at least two that could register as must-haves for hardcore gamers. It starts with Super Smash Bros. Ultimate. The latest edition in the hit Nintendo series arrives in stores on December 7 an...

item.title: This is the best time to buy a Nintendo Switch - Quartz
item.description:
This is the best time to buy a Nintendo Switch  Quartz

The Nintendo Switch, the company’s latest console, is a smash success. But while I loved the Switch from the moment Nintendo released it in March 2017, I also warned off all but the most ardent fans: For $300, there just wasn’t enough to play. By the 2017 holiday season, Nintendo and its partners had filled that void, releasing a swath of games that made the console a must-buy for many. But discounts were still few and far between. This holiday season, retailers are at last pushing deals on the Switch. There are also even more games, so now might be a great time to go ahead and pick one up....

item.title: This New Fan Made 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' And Queen Mash-Up Trailer Is Insanely Good - Forbes
item.description:
This New Fan Made 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' And Queen Mash-Up Trailer Is Insanely Good  Forbes

The new ‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ trailer has been given a great Queen mash-up. With Nintendo dropping a new trailer for Super Smash Bros. Ultimate over the weekend, it didn’t take long for someone to do a mash-up with a classic Queen song and the results are utterly great. Specifically, the 1978 song Don’t Stop Me Now has been merged with the latest Super Smash Bros. Ultimate trailer, that weirdly didn’t have any music of its own to begin with. Bringing the “Everyone Is Here!“ artwork to life, the trailer shows off the huge variety of playable characters in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate. H...

item.title: Nintendo To Remove Racist Imagery From 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' On Switch - Forbes
item.description:
Nintendo To Remove Racist Imagery From 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' On Switch  Forbes

A livestream promoting Nintendo’s upcoming Super Smash Bros. Ultimate on Thursday came with a bunch of new information for fans of Nintendo’s fighting game series, like three new fighters and details on the game’s surprisingly extensive “spirits” mode. It also came with a racist animation for Mr. Game and Watch, one of the game’s 74 launch fighters. Players noticed it during the middle of gameplay near the 31:00 mark in this livestream: The image led to plenty of discussion across social media and elsewhere. In it, you can see Mr. Game and Watch with a torch and a feather coming out of his ...

item.title: Nintendo Has Already Finalized 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' DLC Roster - International Business Times
item.description:
Nintendo Has Already Finalized 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' DLC Roster  International Business Times

The highly anticipated “Super Smash Bros. Ultimate” will likely be one of the top selling video games of the busy holiday season. The four-player fighting game lets players take control of more than 70 different characters from across Nintendo’s vast library of games, as well as a few from outside it, as well. Nintendo confirmed last week that the game would also get five still-unnamed fighters after launch. Each can be purchased individually for $5.99, or all of them can be bought as a set for $25. According to longtime series director Masahiro Sakurai, Nintendo already chose the post-rele...

item.title: Kirby Is Getting A Giant Head Devouring Plush Next Summer - Forbes
item.description:
Kirby Is Getting A Giant Head Devouring Plush Next Summer  Forbes

The upcoming Kirby plush. Following the recent shocking trailer for Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, we now at least have a giant head devouring plush of Kirby on the way. If you missed the epic World of Light trailer (shown below) it results in Kirby surviving the annihilation of his Super Smash Bros. allies and forced to fix the world alone. Considering that the series started back with HAL Laboratory in 1999 for the N64 and that Masahiro Sakurai has helmed the games in the series since, the fact Kirby has been singled out like this should not be all that surprising. Anyway, everyone loves Kir...

item.title: How to Get Piranha Plant in ‘Smash Ultimate’ - Newsweek
item.description:
How to Get Piranha Plant in ‘Smash Ultimate’  Newsweek

One of the biggest surprises during the Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Nintendo Direct was the reveal that Piranha Plant will be an early purchase bonus for the highly-anticipated fighting game. Memes and Waluigi jokes aside, those looking to pick up Smash Ultimate will want to be able to download this free new character. However, Piranha Plant will only be available to download for a limited time after players register their game. Piranha Plant will be separate from the Fighters Pass in the future, and if you’re looking to secure the new fighter for Super Smash Bros. Ultimate for free, here’s ...

item.title: ‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Spirits Mode Essentials - Newsweek
item.description:
‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Spirits Mode Essentials  Newsweek

The long-rumored Spirits mode in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate was finally revealed in the last Nintendo Direct before the game’s release. Widely thought to be the single-player story mode (that distinction goes to the World of Light adventure mode ), Spirits is an RPG-like game mode that allows players to customize their fighters with special abilities. There was a lot revealed about the Spirits mode during the Nintendo Direct. Here’s everything you need to know about the new game mode. Nintendo WHAT IS SPIRITS? In Smash Ultimate, characters are transformed into “spirits” that can serve as a ...

item.title: ‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Story Mode Explained - Newsweek
item.description:
‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Story Mode Explained  Newsweek

The final minutes of the last Super Smash Bros. Ultimate offered a tease of the upcoming game’s adventure/story mode. Director Masahiro Sakurai said Smash Ultimate ’s adventure mode will be different from Smash Melee’s Subspace Emissary, but avoided revealing too much before the game’s release in December. Thursday’s Nintendo Direct revealed some interesting tidbits about the World of Light story mode Smash fans will want to know. Here’s everything we know about the World of Light story mode. Nintendo THE STORY Before the end of the Direct, a cutscene showing what looks to be the start of t...

item.title: Nintendo Reveals 3 New Fighters For 'Super Smash Bros.' On Switch, And One Is Bizzare - Forbes
item.description:
Nintendo Reveals 3 New Fighters For 'Super Smash Bros.' On Switch, And One Is Bizzare  Forbes

Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo Switch. And that’s all, folks: a series of Nintendo Directs that began at E3 ends today, and Nintendo has now revealed the complete roster of 74 fighters that will be available for the launch of Super Smash Bros. on Nintendo Switch, with the final 2 launch fighters coming in today as well as the game’s first post-launch fighter. That last one is very weird, so let’s dive in here. Ken: Smash bros Ryu has been available for a little while here, and so it makes sense that Ken is showing up now. Ken will be an “echo fighter” of Ryu, something we’ve seen with a few...

item.title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate gets new characters and a social video platform - TechCrunch
item.description:
Super Smash Bros. Ultimate gets new characters and a social video platform  TechCrunch

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate isn’t out until December 7, but Nintendo’s been doing an admirable job milking the fighting game for announcements since it was unveiled back at E3. The company held another Nintendo Direct this morning, to offer up a few more morsels without about a month out from launch. The biggest piece of news here is the launch of Smash World. The platform continues the gaming giant’s recent pivots toward mobile with a video posting service available through the Switch app. Details are still pretty thin, with the promise of more to be “revealed in the future,” but Nintendo s...

item.title: Everything Announced During ‘Smash Ultimate’ Direct - Newsweek
item.description:
Everything Announced During ‘Smash Ultimate’ Direct  Newsweek

The final Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Nintendo Direct gave fans a lot of new information to whet their fighting appetite until the game’s December release, including new characters and what that mysterious game mode from August is. Game Director Masahiro Sakurai gave a rundown of what fans should know about the game in the approximately 40-minute presentation. Here’s everything revealed during the final Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Nintendo Direct. Nintendo NEW CHARACTERS The first new character revealed was Ken from Street Fighter. He is Ryu's Echo Fighter. Ken's signature kicks change and ar...

item.title: How to Watch ‘Smash Ultimate’ Nintendo Direct - Newsweek
item.description:
How to Watch ‘Smash Ultimate’ Nintendo Direct  Newsweek

The final Nintendo Direct focusing on Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is set for this Thursday, and fans of the upcoming fighting game will want to check out the latest details on what is expected to be the hottest game of the winter. Rumors and reports about Smash Ultimate have run rampant online since the last Nintendo Direct, and as this is the last presentation before the game’s release it should shed some light on what’s to come. At the very least it will debunk or confirm any leaks. The last Nintendo Direct on Sept. 13 gave Smash Ultimate fans a look at some neat bundles that will be avail...

item.title: ‘Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Nintendo Direct Predictions - Newsweek
item.description:
‘Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Nintendo Direct Predictions  Newsweek

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is set to release this December and there’s still quite a bit fans don’t know about the upcoming fighting game. Nintendo announced its last Direct dedicated to Super Smash Bros. Ultimate will stream this Thursday, Nov. 1. The Direct will likely give prospective players all the details they would need to know before buying the game. But will Nintendo and Director Masahiro Sakurai give away all the game’s secrets with a month before release? We’ve come up with a few predictions that fans can expect during the approximately 40-minute presentation. Nintendo MORE ROSTE...

item.title: Final ‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Roster - Newsweek
item.description:
Final ‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Roster  Newsweek

The final Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Nintendo Direct gave fans the final roster for the base game. Ken from the Street Fighter franchiseand Incineroar from Pokémon were announced during the 40-minute presentation. These new additions bring the base roster to 74 (including Echo Fighters). Director Masahiro Sakurai confirmed there will be at least five DLC characters that will be announced in the future. However, one more fighter, Piranha Plant from the Super Mario series, will also join Smash Ultimate as a pre-order bonus. Here’s every character coming to Super Smash Bros. Ultimate separated...

item.title: Final ‘Smash Ultimate’ Nintendo Direct This Week - Newsweek
item.description:
Final ‘Smash Ultimate’ Nintendo Direct This Week  Newsweek

Fans are a little more than a month away from the release of Super Smash Bros. Ultimate on Switch, and Nintendo is having the last Direct dedicated to the upcoming fighting game on Nov. 1. Starting at 10 a.m. EDT, the final Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Nintendo Direct will feature approximately 40 minutes of new information about the game. Following the conclusion of the Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Direct, there will be a Nintendo Treehouse: Live that will showcase other Switch titles coming this holiday season. The games expected to appear include Pokémon Let’s Go Pikachu and Let’s Go Eevee, ...

item.title: The Nintendo Switch Is Running Into A Predictable Nintendo Problem - Forbes
item.description:
The Nintendo Switch Is Running Into A Predictable Nintendo Problem  Forbes

Smash While the Nintendo Switch is certainly a hit, and a radical departure from the clear failure of the Wii U, we are starting to see signs that Nintendo is once again dealing with an old problem specific to the company in the last few console races. In a recent earnings report, we learned that Nintendo has sold 22.8 million Switches at this point, roughly on par or a bit below the pace of the PS4. Nintendo has forecast they will sell 20 million Switches during this current fiscal year, but right now they’re only at 5.07 million, halfway through. But this is “in line” with expectations, a...

item.title: Nintendo second-quarter profit hits eight-year high, powered by Switch sales - Reuters
item.description:
Nintendo second-quarter profit hits eight-year high, powered by Switch sales  Reuters

Japan's Nintendo Co Ltd (7974.T: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz) on Tuesday said sales of Switch consoles and games pushed operating profit up 30 percent in the July-September period to reach its highest quarterly result in eight years. Second-quarter profit hit 30.9 billion yen ($274.11 million), the Kyoto-based gaming company said, though that undershot analyst estimates. Nintendo also said it sold 5.07 million of its Switch consoles over April-September, and maintained its sales forecast for the year ending March at 20 million consoles. President Shuntaro Furukawa, who assumed the ...

item.title: Nintendo Reports Biggest Profit Jump In Years - International Business Times
item.description:
Nintendo Reports Biggest Profit Jump In Years  International Business Times

Though the second year of the Nintendo Switch’s life has not featured the same number of big-name titles as the first, the console continues to do well for Nintendo. The Japanese gaming firm reported its highest second-quarter profit in nearly a decade in its earnings report released Tuesday. The Switch sold 5.07 million units in the six months prior to Sept. 30, when the company’s fiscal year 2019 reached its halfway point. That brought the Switch’s lifetime sales to more than 22 million units since March 2017, meaning it has now sold more in a year and a half than the Wii U and GameCube c...

item.title: Is This ‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Roster Leak Real? - Newsweek
item.description:
Is This ‘Super Smash Bros. Ultimate’ Roster Leak Real?  Newsweek

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is set to release on Switch this December but it seems the growing roster is getting bigger, if this latest leak is to be believed. An unnamed person who claims to have access to promotional material took photos of the Super Smash Bros. Ultimate roster collage on their Snapchat. The post was deleted, but later posted on message boards like 4Chan and Resetera. Nintendo has not officially confirmed any of these characters for the game at this time. SPOILERS! If you don’t want to know about the possible Super Smash Bros. Ultimate leaked roster turn away now. Nintendo...

item.title: Sony and Nintendo pin hopes on new games launches - Financial Times
item.description:
Sony and Nintendo pin hopes on new games launches  Financial Times

The new presidents of Nintendo and Sony are betting heavily on the seasonal temptations of Wild West gunslingers, ancient Greek mercenaries and a madcap punch-up as Japan’s games console giants battle to maintain record earnings into 2019. The companies’ focus on their respective pipelines of new games come as Sony said it was targeting a second consecutive full year of record profits led by its PlayStation division. Nintendo, meanwhile, reaffirmed a sales goal that calls for it to sell nearly 15m units of its Switch console between October 1 and the end of March. The two companies, which r...

item.title: Nintendo turns to old favorites Mario and Pokémon to hit lofty Switch target - TechCrunch
item.description:
Nintendo turns to old favorites Mario and Pokémon to hit lofty Switch target  TechCrunch

Nintendo is betting that two of its most-beloved franchises — Mario and Pokémon — can help it hit its lofty goal of selling 20 million Switch consoles this financial year. The company made the bold prediction at the start of its financial year and now, six months later, the Switch sales count stands at 5.07 million units going into the festive period, as according to the company’s latest financials. Nintendo will be hoping for a big boost towards its goal around Christmas but, as The Verge notes, it sold ‘just’ 7.23 million units during Christmas 2017. Already the arrival of Fortnite has gi...

item.title: Gamestop Will Give You $200 Towards A Nintendo Switch When You Trade-In A Nintendo Switch - Forbes
item.description:
Gamestop Will Give You $200 Towards A Nintendo Switch When You Trade-In A Nintendo Switch  Forbes

the Nintendo Switch. No, this headline is not wrong. Gamestop runs trade-in deals all the time, and it’s particularly active with them as we move into the Black Friday and holiday season. This one, however, has got to take the cake for pure strangeness: the retailer is offering a $200 trade-in value for a Nintendo Switch when you trade it in for…another Nintendo Switch. That brings the price of a new Switch down to just $100, which would be a great deal if you didn’t…already have one. It’s almost brilliant: by going after Nintendo Switch owners, Gamestop has identified the people who have a...

item.title: ‘SoulCalibur VI’s Character Creation Is Insane - Newsweek
item.description:
‘SoulCalibur VI’s Character Creation Is Insane  Newsweek

One of the best features of SoulCalibur VI is its character creation mode, and fans have made good use of it on its first general release day. The surprisingly deep creation suite has allowed players to bring their favorite fictional characters into SoulCalibur VI, whether it’s from the world of comics, TV, movies or anime. Here are some of our favorite SoulCalibur VI creations. Newsgeek/Reddit Faith the Magdalena - Top Cow Comics Alright, this one is a bit of a cheap plug: I created this one. Faith the Magdalena is the fictional offspring of Jesus of Nazareth in the world of Top Cow Comics...

item.title: 'Black Ops 4' More Anticipated Than 'Red Dead 2' - Newsweek
item.description:
'Black Ops 4' More Anticipated Than 'Red Dead 2'  Newsweek

After numerous delays and slow but steady trickles of information, it’s safe to say hype for Red Dead Redemption 2 is at an all-time high right now. However, according to a recent poll from Nielsen, Red Dead 2 isn’t the most anticipated game this holiday season. That award goes to Call of Duty Black Ops 4. Nielsen asked nearly 6,000 people their thoughts on 82 different games due to be released between Sept. 1 and Dec. 31 of 2018. Nielsen then calculated scores for each game based on consumer awareness, purchase interest and consumer ratings. The top-scoring games are as follows: The most a...

item.title: Sources: Nintendo Launching Upgraded Switch As Early As Summer 2019 - Forbes
item.description:
Sources: Nintendo Launching Upgraded Switch As Early As Summer 2019  Forbes

Nintendo is planning to inject new life into the Switch to ensure the runaway sales success of its hybrid home console and handheld remains a runaway success. The updated Switch console could hit store shelves as early as Summer 2019. An enhanced Switch would probably bring more benefits to its portable side than its home console side. The report comes via the Wall Street Journal, citing multiple sources with knowledge of the plans including suppliers. WSJ spoke to several insiders who shared that Nintendo is considering upgrades to both software and hardware. Crucially, however, these upgr...

item.title: Nintendo Direct: Animal Crossing Switch, Luigi's Mansion 3 and all the other news - The Telegraph
item.description:
Nintendo Direct: Animal Crossing Switch, Luigi's Mansion 3 and all the other news  The Telegraph

Nintendo has finally confirmed that the anthropomorphic town management sim Animal Crossing will be coming to its Nintendo Switch console in 2019. The news was revealed at the end of the Japanese video game giant's Nintendo Direct video stream, which showcased the company's upcoming games for both Switch and Nintendo 3DS. There was little information revealed on the game, but featured the famously penny-pinching tanuki Tom Nook announcing he needed to build a new town for his friends. Presumably so he can rob them blind. Recent Animal Crossing games cast you as the Mayor of a small village,...

item.title: Nintendo Direct: Animal Crossing Switch, Splatoon Battle Royale and Luigi's Mansion 3 announced - The Telegraph

Nintendo has finally confirmed that the anthropomorphic town management sim Animal Crossing will be coming to its Nintendo Switch console in 2019. Presumably so he can rob them blind. Recent Animal Crossing games cast you as the Mayor of a small village,...

item.title: Here Are All The Nintendo Switch 'Nindies' Releasing In 2018 And Early 2019 - Forbes Now
item.description:
Here Are All The Nintendo Switch 'Nindies' Releasing In 2018 And Early 2019  Forbes Now

Bastion and lots of other great indie games are headed to the Nintendo Switch in coming months. Nintendo just revealed a long list of “Nindies’ coming to the Nintendo Switch over the next few months. These indie releases range from platformers to RPGs to tactical turn-based games. There’s a lot coming to the Nintendo Switch in late 2018 and early 2019 aside from the big releases like Super Smash Bros. Ultimate. Here’s the full list. I haven’t played all of these (on other platforms) but I have played some. Let’s take a look. 2018 Releases - Into The Breach (Released today) - The Messenger (...

item.title: Nintendo Bringing ‘Smash’ and ‘Pokémon’ to PAX West - Newsweek
item.description:
Nintendo Bringing ‘Smash’ and ‘Pokémon’ to PAX West  Newsweek

Fans attending this year’s PAX West from Aug. 31 to Sept. 3 will get to try out some of the year’s most anticipated Nintendo Switch titles, including Super Smash Bros. Ultimate and Pokémon Let’s Go Pikachu and Eevee. Nintendo will host a variety of giveaways and demos on the PAX West showfloor as well as around the Seattle area. On Aug. 31 and Sept. 1, representatives from Nintendo will be hiding out in various parts of the convention center and surrounding area. Follow the Nintendo of America Twitter account to see clues where to find them and answer a trivia question to receive a special ...

item.title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate adds popular characters from Castlevania and Donkey Kong - Entertainment Weekly News
item.description:
Super Smash Bros. Ultimate adds popular characters from Castlevania and Donkey Kong  Entertainment Weekly News

Nintendo Luigi has seen his share of spooks in haunted mansions, but Wednesday’s Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Nintendo Direct was the first time he’d literally faced death. Luckily, Castlevania series star Simon Belmont was on hand to save the mascot’s harvested soul. Simon, who has starred in Castlevania games ranging all the way back to the 1986 original on NES, will wield his famous whip in the new game. The inclusion of Simon and fellow vampire hunter Richter Belmont as playable characters in Ultimate was the first of many reveals packed into the half-hour Direct presentation, hosted by S...

item.title: From Kong to Kirby: Smash Bros' Masahiro Sakurai on mashing up 35 years of gaming history - The Guardian
item.description:
From Kong to Kirby: Smash Bros' Masahiro Sakurai on mashing up 35 years of gaming history  The Guardian

Masahiro Sakurai is 48 years old, but looks almost ageless. In his face, you can see the prodigious teenager he once was. Sakurai was 19 when he directed his first game, Kirby’s Dream Land, at HAL Laboratory, a Tokyo developer that made a string of excellent games for Nintendo’s consoles in the 90s. His parents were perplexed; in their generation, video games didn’t exist. “They never supported me actively, there was a lot of uncertainty and fear,” he recalls. “That said, after I worked on the Kirby games, I noticed that all of a sudden my parents had Kirby paraphernalia hanging around the ...

item.title: Nintendo Reveals Five New 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' Fighters And 103 Stages - Forbes Now
item.description:
Nintendo Reveals Five New 'Super Smash Bros. Ultimate' Fighters And 103 Stages  Forbes Now

Smash Bros. After showing off the fact that Super Smash Bros. Ultimate would contain every single fighter from every past game, it seemed like perhaps there wasn’t all that much more to debut. But that was not the case, as Nintendo had a Direct today that they jammed full of information, including a number of reveals. We’ll start with the most pressing additions, five new characters, two of which are truly new, three of which are “echo fighters,” which are clones of existing fighters, but with new looks and animations. So we have: Simon Belmont: This was leaked yesterday thanks to Nintendo ...

item.title: Nintendo’s profit jumps 88% as it nears 20 million Switch sales - TechCrunch
item.description:
Nintendo’s profit jumps 88% as it nears 20 million Switch sales  TechCrunch

Nintendo released its latest earnings report today and the headline is that the company has now sold nearly 20 million Switch consoles. The actual number is 19.67 million as of the end of June, so add July sales and the 20 million milestone is likely to have already been hit. Either way, it has easily surpassed its predecessor, the much-maligned Wii U. Overall, the business recorded a 30.5 billion JPY ($275 million) operating profit, up 88 percent year-on-year, as revenue grew 9 percent to reach 168 billion JPY, or $1.5 billion. The Japanese firm sold 1.88 million Switches in the most recen...

item.title: Nintendo reports 88% hike in profits on strong sales of Switch - Fast Company
item.description:
Nintendo reports 88% hike in profits on strong sales of Switch  Fast Company

Nintendo has sold almost 20 million Switch consoles, including 1.88 million of them in the second quarter, boosting the company’s operating profit to 30.5 billion JPY ($275 million), according to its latest earnings report today That’s an 88 percent increase over the same period last year, with revenue growing 9 percent to 168 billion JPY ($1.5 billion). By the end of June, the legendary video game maker had sold 19.67 million Switch consoles (not counting July sales) in total, with sales of Switch games skyrocketing from 8.1 million in the second quarter last year to 17.96 million in this ...

item.title: Nintendo Reports Strong Profits In Q1 - International Business Times
item.description:
Nintendo Reports Strong Profits In Q1  International Business Times

Japanese gaming giant Nintendo Co. released earnings Tuesday for the first fiscal quarter, with profits up significantly despite revenue concerns of the Switch console, according to reports. Nintendo made $274 million in operating profit for the quarter, which was a nearly 90 percent increase from the same time last year. The popular Switch console saw its first full year on the market, making Nintendo’s year-on-year profit increase noteworthy. Nintendo sold almost 1.9 million Switch consoles and around 18 million games during the previous quarter, according to GamesIndustry.biz. Since ther...

item.title: Why Are Investors Panicking About The Nintendo Switch? - Forbes Now
item.description:
Why Are Investors Panicking About The Nintendo Switch?  Forbes Now

WAHHH Something odd is happening with Nintendo stock in the last few months. After peaking around March, Nintendo shares have slowly been sliding downward, and more recently, the pace of decline has been accelerating with drops of as much as 5% in a single day. In total, shares are down about 34% since March. What on earth is going on? We’re supposed to still be living in a Nintendo renaissance of sorts, a golden era in the wake of smash hits like Pokémon GO (which caused a huge stock jump in summer 2016) and the Switch (which has continued the trend since release). 2017 brought us two of N...
